Normality Analysis

Source: R/normality.R
normality.Rd

Check normality of a vector of values.

normality(
  x,
  na.rm = getOption("na.rm", FALSE),
  type = getOption("quantile.type", 7)
)

Arguments

x

vector of values

na.rm

Remove empty values

type

an integer between 1 and 9 selecting one of the nine quantile algorithms detailed below to be used.

Default values of na.rm

This 'certestats' package supports a global default setting for na.rm in many mathematical functions. This can be set with options(na.rm = TRUE) or options(na.rm = FALSE).

For normality(), quantile() and IQR(), this also applies to the type argument. The default, type = 7, is the default of base R. Use type = 6 to comply with SPSS.

Examples

x <- runif(1000)
normality(x)

#> # A tibble: 4 × 5
#>   statistic   p.value method                                     inter…¹ suggest
#>       <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>                                      <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1    0.946   1.23e-18 Shapiro-Wilk normality test                Not no… NA     
#> 2    0.500   0        Asymptotic one-sample Kolmogorov-Smirnov … Not no… NA     
#> 3    0.0264 NA        Skewness                                   0 in n… NA     
#> 4    1.72   NA        Kurtosis                                   3 in n… NA     
#> # … with abbreviated variable name ¹​interpretation

x <- rnorm(1000)
normality(x)

#> # A tibble: 4 × 5
#>   statistic p.value method                                       inter…¹ suggest
#>       <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>                                        <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1    0.997   0.115  Shapiro-Wilk normality test                  Normal… (as is)
#> 2    0.0394  0.0900 Asymptotic one-sample Kolmogorov-Smirnov te… Normal… (as is)
#> 3   -0.156  NA      Skewness                                     0 in n… NA     
#> 4    2.94   NA      Kurtosis                                     3 in n… NA     
#> # … with abbreviated variable name ¹​interpretation

x <- rexp(1000, rate = 3)
normality(x)

#> # A tibble: 4 × 5
#>   statistic   p.value method                                     inter…¹ suggest
#>       <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>                                      <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1     0.823  8.21e-32 Shapiro-Wilk normality test                Not no… NA     
#> 2     0.500  0        Asymptotic one-sample Kolmogorov-Smirnov … Not no… NA     
#> 3     1.79  NA        Skewness                                   0 in n… NA     
#> 4     6.86  NA        Kurtosis                                   3 in n… NA     
#> # … with abbreviated variable name ¹​interpretation
